thread.title: Recently unemployed man goes missing during CNY
thread.title_full: Recently unemployed man goes missing during CNY

title: Recently unemployed man goes missing during CNY

organizations.name: mca public services and complaints bureau

text:
Sunday, 5 February 2017 Recently unemployed man goes missing during CNY Seen him?: Teoh (left) and Tan holding up a police report and picture of Ngo in Johor Baru. 
JOHOR BARU: The family of an unemployed man who went missing days after Chinese New Year wants him to contact them. 
His wife Tan Hwee Lik, who took their two children to visit relatives in Muar on Jan 30, said her last contact with him was at 5.30am the next day by telephone. 
Tan, 41, said Francis Ngo, 40, had backed out of the trip at the last minute, opting to stay alone at their house in Lima Kedai, Gelang Patah. 
“Before we left for Muar, he caressed my head like a child and told me to take care of our children and to have fun,” Tan said at a press conference organised by the MCA Public Services and Complaints bureau chief Datuk Jason Teoh here on Friday. 
“When we arrived home around 9pm on Tuesday night he was nowhere to be found,” she said, adding that Ngo’s passport and identity documents were missing too. 
“My neighbours claimed that after we left for Muar they saw him leaving the house on foot with a backpack between 7am and 8am,” Tan said, adding that another neighbour spotted him at a bus stop. 
Tan said Ngo, who lost his job in Singapore a year ago, took on several odd jobs like washing dishes and working at a lok-lok stall. 
“If his intention was to leave and look for work, I hope he will inform us of his whereabouts as we are all worried about him,” said Tan. 
Iskandar Puteri OCPD Supt Noor Hashim Mohamad said the investigation has so far revealed no criminal element in Ngo’s disappearance. 
Those with information can contact Teoh at 019-711 1516 or Kampung Baru Lima Kedai village head Loo Ng Chai at 019-776 5993.
